commit_message:
Allow configurable signing backends

Make the signing backends configurable and expose the local implementation as a
default option.

Change-Id: I4d4fc649c9539d90d02b0e4d6888f79958a670da
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/94/201394/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Signing backends ================ Anchor allows the use of configurable signing backend. While it provides one implementation (based on cryptography.io and OpenSSL), other implementations may be configured. The backend is configured by setting ca.backend configuration value to the name of the right module. Backend implementations need to provide only one function: sign(csr, conf), taking the parsed CSR and the "ca" block of the configuration as parameters and returning signed certificate in PEM format. If `ca.backend` is not defined, it defaults to string `anchor.certificate_ops` The resulting certificate is stored locally if the `output_path` is set to any string. This does not depend on the configured backend. Backends can specify their own options - please refer to the backend documentation for the specific list. The default backend takes the following options: * `cert_path`: path where local CA certificate can be found * `key_path`: path to the key for that certificate * `signing_hash`: which hash method to use when producing signatures * `valid_hours`: number of hours the signed certificates are valid for Sample configuration for the default backend: "ca": { "cert_path": "CA/root-ca.crt", "key_path": "CA/root-ca-unwrapped.key", "output_path": "certs", "signing_hash": "sha256", "valid_hours": 24 }

subject: Implement new API format
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-11 04:16:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/anchor/commit/125bd2916ea9c50350025fd1ac54eac24850b35d', 'message': 'Move signing request into V1 controller

Prepare for future changes by moving sign controller into a version
namespace.

Change-Id: I5a949e0c79a2d56eadadf5ece62bb8b8eea89e78
Closes-bug: 1463752
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-24 07:01:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/anchor/commit/a3c928f2ed12e7b36741fff42ff8d6e25c8afb86', 'message': 'New api format

Signing requests are expected to arrive at

/v1/sign/<instance name>

now. Instance is a new concept which right now includes everything the
original configuration included. That means for example each instance
available within Anchor deployment can configure its own CA, auth,
validators. Clients require a specific instance via the URL. This does
not mean they can choose who signs the CSR - they still need to pass
all checks. Only the guesswork of "which validation set applies to
them" is gone.

The previous concept of validator sets is gone. Each instance
configures its own validators and all of them need to pass.

Previous endpoint /sign will not work anymore. It's incompatible with
the new design.

The configuration file changes in the following way:
1. Instances can be defined inline or read from a directory.
2. Validator sets are not available anymore.
3. CA and auth settings at the top level are the defaults. They can be
   overridden in the instance configuration.

A sample inline config looks like this:

    {
      "auth": {
        "static": {
          "secret": "simplepassword",
          "user": "myusername"
        }
      },
      "ca": {
        "cert_path": "CA/root-ca.crt",
        "key_path": "CA/root-ca-unwrapped.key",
        "output_path": "certs",
        "signing_hash": "sha256",
        "valid_hours": 24
      },
      "instances": {
        "default": {
          "validators": {
            "common_name" : {
              "allowed_domains": [
                ".example.com"
                ]
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }

The effect is the same as replacing "instances" with:

    "configs_directory": "anchor.d"

and providing a file "anchor.d/default.conf" with contents:

    {
      "validators": {
        "common_name" : {
          "allowed_domains": [
            ".example.com"
            ]
        }
      }
    }

This change makes it easier to configure multiple instances
from multiple deployment scripts/tools.

Closes-bug: 1463752
Change-Id: I5a949e0c79a2d56eadadf5ece62bb8b8eea89e78
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-30 00:48:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/anchor/commit/decffb5fc8e10bda24d86d87947864604f729f5c', 'message': 'New api format

Signing requests are expected to arrive at

/v1/sign/<instance name>

now. Instance is a new concept which right now includes everything the
original configuration included. That means for example each instance
available within Anchor deployment can configure its own CA, auth,
validators. Clients require a specific instance via the URL. This does
not mean they can choose who signs the CSR - they still need to pass
all checks. Only the guesswork of "which validation set applies to
them" is gone.

The previous concept of validator sets is gone. Each instance
configures its own validators and all of them need to pass.

Previous endpoint /sign will not work anymore. It's incompatible with
the new design.

The configuration file changes in the following way:
1. Instances need to be defined in the main config.
2. Validator sets are not available anymore.
3. CA and auth settings at the top level are the defaults. They can be
   overridden in the instance configuration.

A sample inline config looks like this:

    {
      "auth": {
        "static": {
          "secret": "simplepassword",
          "user": "myusername"
        }
      },
      "ca": {
        "cert_path": "CA/root-ca.crt",
        "key_path": "CA/root-ca-unwrapped.key",
        "output_path": "certs",
        "signing_hash": "sha256",
        "valid_hours": 24
      },
      "instances": {
        "default": {
          "validators": {
            "common_name" : {
              "allowed_domains": [
                ".example.com"
                ]
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }

Closes-bug: 1463752
Change-Id: I5a949e0c79a2d56eadadf5ece62bb8b8eea89e78
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-30 01:05:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/anchor/commit/606e6c22d5aab92ba5669801181b53adf110b9a4', 'message': 'New api format

'}, {'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-03 00:07:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/anchor/commit/53c9fdb6655f871020989a26ecbc364b2005f7f8', 'message': 'New api format

Signing requests are expected to arrive at

/v1/sign/<instance name>

now. Instance is a new concept which right now includes everything the
original configuration included. That means for example each instance
available within Anchor deployment can configure its own CA, auth,
validators. Clients require a specific instance via the URL. This does
not mean they can choose who signs the CSR - they still need to pass
all checks. Only the guesswork of "which validation set applies to
them" is gone.

The previous concept of validator sets is gone. Each instance
configures its own validators and all of them need to pass.

Previous endpoint /sign will not work anymore. It's incompatible with
the new design.

The configuration file changes in the following way:
1. Instances need to be defined in the main config.
2. Validator sets are not available anymore.
3. CA and auth settings at the top level are the defaults. They can be
   overridden in the instance configuration.

A sample inline config looks like this:

    {
      "auth": {
        "static": {
          "secret": "simplepassword",
          "user": "myusername"
        }
      },
      "ca": {
        "cert_path": "CA/root-ca.crt",
        "key_path": "CA/root-ca-unwrapped.key",
        "output_path": "certs",
        "signing_hash": "sha256",
        "valid_hours": 24
      },
      "instances": {
        "default": {
          "validators": {
            "common_name" : {
              "allowed_domains": [
                ".example.com"
                ]
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }

Closes-bug: 1463752
Change-Id: I5a949e0c79a2d56eadadf5ece62bb8b8eea89e78

'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-29 07:44:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/anchor/commit/71538bca45058017e10fd3fc58bb690c059da266', 'message': '[WIP] Implement new API format

WIP - docs reflect new naming / config layout, but code doesn't

Signing requests are expected to arrive at

/v1/sign/<registration_authority>

now. Virtual registration authority is a new concept which right now includes
everything the original configuration included. That means for example each
registration authority available within Anchor deployment can configure its own
CA, auth, and validators. Clients request a specific registration authority via
the URL. This does not mean they can just choose who signs the CSR - they still
need to pass all checks. Only the guesswork of "which validation set applies to
them" is gone because of this change.

The previous concept of validator sets is gone. Each registration authority
configures its own validators and all of them need to pass.

Previous endpoint /sign will not work anymore. It's incompatible with
the new design.

The configuration file changes in the following way:
1. Registration authorities need to be defined in the main config.
2. Validator sets are not available anymore.
3. CA and auth settings at the top level need to be named. They can be referred
   to in the registration authority block.
4. Old names are removed. Any use of "auth", "ca", or "validators" at the top
   level will result in an error and explanation regarding the upgrade path.

Further documentation and a sample config with the new layout can be found in
the docs/configuration.rst file.

Closes-bug: 1463752
Change-Id: I5a949e0c79a2d56eadadf5ece62bb8b8eea89e78

commit_message:
Implement new API format

Signing requests are expected to arrive at

/v1/sign/<registration_authority>

now. Virtual registration authority is a new concept which right now includes
everything the original configuration included. That means for example each
registration authority available within Anchor deployment can configure its own
CA, auth, and validators. Clients request a specific registration authority via
the URL. This does not mean they can just choose who signs the CSR - they still
need to pass all checks. Only the guesswork of "which validation set applies to
them" is gone because of this change.

The previous concept of validator sets is gone. Each registration authority
configures its own validators and all of them need to pass.

Previous endpoint /sign will not work anymore. It's incompatible with
the new design.

The configuration file changes in the following way:
1. Registration authorities need to be defined in the main config.
2. Validator sets are not available anymore.
3. CA and auth settings at the top level need to be named. They can be referred
   to in the registration authority block.
4. Old names are removed. Any use of "auth", "ca", or "validators" at the top
   level will result in an error and explanation regarding the upgrade path.

Further documentation and a sample config with the new layout can be found in
the docs/configuration.rst file.

Closes-bug: 1463752
Change-Id: I5a949e0c79a2d56eadadf5ece62bb8b8eea89e78

commit_message:
Move sample config for tests to one place

Multiple tests used their own version of "minimal config". Moving this
to a separate class reduces repetition. Also makes new changes like the
API patch smaller.

Change-Id: Ie15adb0befc7fc95f991faf1c303ea385b784288
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/52/207752/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class DefaultConfigMixin(object): """Mixin for reuse in any test class which needs to load a config. `sample_conf` is always a valid, no thrills configuration. It can be reused in any test case. Constructing it in setUp() guarantees that it can be changed without affecting other tests. """ def setUp(self): self.sample_conf_auth = { "static": { "user": "myusername", "secret": "simplepassword" } } self.sample_conf_ca = { "cert_path": "tests/CA/root-ca.crt", "key_path": "tests/CA/root-ca-unwrapped.key", "output_path": "certs", "signing_hash": "sha256", "valid_hours": 24 } self.sample_conf_validators = { "steps": { "common_name": { "allowed_domains": [".test.com"] } } } self.sample_conf = { "auth": self.sample_conf_auth, "ca": self.sample_conf_ca, "validators": self.sample_conf_validators, } super(DefaultConfigMixin, self).setUp()

subject: Make sure Glance_image is executed after Keystone_endpoint
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 01:58:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/07f60a7724a64accc434f0e8d432c0d84764b03d', 'message': 'Make sure Glance_image is executed after Keystone_service

When running Keystone in WSGI, Glance_image is not run in the right
moment.
This patch aims to make sure Glance_image is run after creating Glance
service Keystone resource by using the Puppet chain arrow.
If Glance_image resource is in the catalog, it will be executed when
keystone & glance are actually ready and not before.

Change-Id: I97d1a77c5f4a67914738514d773ecbd4bfb2196c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-25 02:00:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/17504864e0fc5d03a72b9463ee099596a1cb5fe0', 'message': 'Make sure Glance_image is executed after Keystone_service

When running Keystone in WSGI, Glance_image is not run in the right
moment.
This patch aims to make sure Glance_image is run after creating Glance
service Keystone resource by using the Puppet chain arrow.
If Glance_image resource is in the catalog, it will be executed when
keystone & glance are actually ready and not before.

Closes-Bug: #1488277
Change-Id: I97d1a77c5f4a67914738514d773ecbd4bfb2196c
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-26 03:48:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-glance/commit/dcae01c48ff90f68f5118a943a19e7d4ba0fea1c', 'message': 'Make sure Glance_image is executed after Keystone_endpoint

When running Keystone in WSGI, Glance_image is not run in the right
moment.
This patch aims to make sure Glance_image is run after creating Glance
endpoint Keystone resource by using the Puppet chain arrow.
Keystone_endpoint is actually the latest resource created by Keystone
providers to make Glance working.
If Glance_image resource is in the catalog, it will be executed when
keystone & glance are actually ready and not before.

commit_message:
Make sure Glance_image is executed after Keystone_endpoint

When running Keystone in WSGI, Glance_image is not run in the right
moment.
This patch aims to make sure Glance_image is run after creating Glance
endpoint Keystone resource by using the Puppet chain arrow.
Keystone_endpoint is actually the latest resource created by Keystone
providers to make Glance working.
If Glance_image resource is in the catalog, it will be executed when
keystone & glance are actually ready and not before.

Closes-Bug: #1488277
Change-Id: I97d1a77c5f4a67914738514d773ecbd4bfb2196c

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ossa refs/changes/04/219304/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: date: 2015-09-01 id: OSSA-2015-017 title: 'Nova may fail to delete images in resize state' description: 'George Shuklin from Webzilla LTD and Tushar Patil from NTT DATA, Inc independently reported a vulnerability in Nova resize state. If an authenticated user deletes an instance while it is in resize state, it will cause the original instance to not be deleted from the compute node it was running on. An attacker can use this to launch a denial of service attack. All Nova setups are affected.' affected-products: - product: nova version: 2014.2 versions through 2014.2.3, and 2015.1 versions through 2015.1.1 vulnerabilities: - cve-id: CVE-2015-3280 reporters: - name: 'George Shuklin' affiliation: Webzilla LTD reported: - CVE-2015-3280 - name: 'Tushar Patil' affiliation: NTT Data reported: - CVE-2015-3280 issues: links: - https://launchpad.net/bugs/1392527 type: launchpad reviews: liberty: - https://review.openstack.org/219299 kilo: - https://review.openstack.org/219300 juno: - https://review.openstack.org/219301 type: gerrit notes: - 'This fix will be included in future 2014.2.4 (juno) and 2015.1.2 (kilo) releases.'

commit_message:
Use directly neutron.common.constants constants in l3_dvr_db

l3_dvr_db defines local constants referencing nonlocal[1]
constants but uses local and nonlocal constants. This change
unifies the code by removing local constants and
using [1] constants.

[1] in neutron.common.constants module

Change-Id: I6548c8eb2a434967b37910e39fa79a883da4e280

commit_message:
Python 3: use a key to sort list of dictionaries

In Python 3, one cannot write "adict < anotherdict". Therefore the key argument
must be passed to the sorted function when sorting a list of dictionaries.

Change-Id: I4d545a83cc5b6df5dd00b00b1eb978fd7fc8d74c
Blueprint: neutron-python3

commit_message:
Refactoring Unit Test Directories

This commit creates two paths in tests, /unit and /functional.
As we begin to ensure proper unit test coverage we want to use
conventions whenever possible to keep our tests properly separated
and in conventional locations.

Change-Id: Iaa1186c4b77a52ed1cdb6fb29218307310b41702

subject: Move caching of resolved router_ids from state machine to worker
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-05 01:19:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/astara/commit/9b79d61facfb2de6a884f7fd4683d03cdcee17ab', 'message': 'Move caching of resolved router_ids from state machine to worker

If an event comes in that does not have a associated router_id, we attempt
to call out to neutron to resolve it by tenant_id and cache it locally on
the TenantRouterManager instance. This happens during get_state_machines()
and, if a router could not be found, the event msg effectively gets dropped.

This is a bit of a waste of Neutron calls if the event happens to be one
that would be ignored later on by the worker (for global or tenant debug,
fo example)

This moves that caching out to the worker using a dumb in-memory dict based
cache (we could back this by memcache and improve it if it ends up being
beneficial)  Instead of having the TRM decide to drop messages with no
associated router, we move that responsibility up to the worker where its
already doing similar things around debug modes.  Ensuring the worker has
visibility of the router_id at all times will later let it use this as a
hash key when RUGs are managed using a distributed hash ring.

Partially implements: blueprint rug-scaling

Change-Id: Iaf2ded91c2c777855f874ac01a54e96c9045e29c
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-08-05 21:49:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/astara/commit/7c2407d61a518039c1dc5ed38aaeb7b02a059d48', 'message': 'Move caching of resolved router_ids from state machine to worker

If an event comes in that does not have a associated router_id, we attempt
to call out to neutron to resolve it by tenant_id and cache it locally on
the TenantRouterManager instance. This happens during get_state_machines()
and, if a router could not be found, the event msg effectively gets dropped.

This is a bit of a waste of Neutron calls if the event happens to be one
that would be ignored later on by the worker (for global or tenant debug,
fo example)

This moves that caching out to the worker using a dumb in-memory dict based
cache (we could back this by memcache and improve it if it ends up being
beneficial)  Instead of having the TRM decide to drop messages with no
associated router, we move that responsibility up to the worker where its
already doing similar things around debug modes.  Ensuring the worker has
visibility of the router_id at all times will later let it use this as a
hash key when RUGs are managed using a distributed hash ring.

Partially implements: blueprint rug-scaling

Change-Id: Iaf2ded91c2c777855f874ac01a54e96c9045e29c
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-08-06 02:46:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/astara/commit/394590e6fdb6bba018808f70235315c9168585eb', 'message': 'Move caching of resolved router_ids from state machine to worker

If an event comes in that does not have a associated router_id, we attempt
to call out to neutron to resolve it by tenant_id and cache it locally on
the TenantRouterManager instance. This happens during get_state_machines()
and, if a router could not be found, the event msg effectively gets dropped.

This is a bit of a waste of Neutron calls if the event happens to be one
that would be ignored later on by the worker (for global or tenant debug,
fo example)

This moves that caching out to the worker using a dumb in-memory dict based
cache (we could back this by memcache and improve it if it ends up being
beneficial)  Instead of having the TRM decide to drop messages with no
associated router, we move that responsibility up to the worker where its
already doing similar things around debug modes.  Ensuring the worker has
visibility of the router_id at all times will later let it use this as a
hash key when RUGs are managed using a distributed hash ring.

Partially implements: blueprint rug-scaling

Change-Id: Iaf2ded91c2c777855f874ac01a54e96c9045e29c

commit_message:
Move caching of resolved router_ids from state machine to worker

If an event comes in that does not have a associated router_id, we attempt
to call out to neutron to resolve it by tenant_id and cache it locally on
the TenantRouterManager instance. This happens during get_state_machines()
and, if a router could not be found, the event msg effectively gets dropped.

This is a bit of a waste of Neutron calls if the event happens to be one
that would be ignored later on by the worker (for global or tenant debug,
for example)

This moves that caching out to the worker using a dumb in-memory dict based
cache (we could back this by memcache and improve it if it ends up being
beneficial)  Instead of having the TRM decide to drop messages with no
associated router, we move that responsibility up to the worker where its
already doing similar things around debug modes.  Ensuring the worker has
visibility of the router_id at all times will later let it use this as a
hash key when RUGs are managed using a distributed hash ring.

Partially implements: blueprint rug-scaling

Change-Id: Iaf2ded91c2c777855f874ac01a54e96c9045e29c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/astara refs/changes/03/209303/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TenantRouterCache(object): """Holds a cache of default router_ids for tenants. This is constructed and consulted when we receieve messages with no associated router_id and avoids a Neutron call per-message of this type. """ # NOTE(adam_g): This is a pretty dumb caching layer and can be backed # by an external system like memcache to further optimize lookups # across mulitple rugs. _tenant_routers = {} def get_by_tenant(self, tenant_uuid, worker_context): if tenant_uuid not in self._tenant_routers: router_uuid = worker_context.neutron.get_router_for_tenant( tenant_uuid) if not router_uuid: LOG.debug('router not found for tenant %s' % tenant_uuid) return None self._tenant_routers[tenant_uuid] = router_uuid return self._tenant_routers[router_uuid] self.router_cache = TenantRouterCache() def _populate_router_id(self, message): """Ensure message is populated with a router_id if it does not contain one. If not, attempt to lookup by tenant :param message: event.Event object :returns: event.Event object with a populated router_id if found. """ if message.router_id: return message LOG.debug("Looking for router for %s", message.tenant_id) router_id = self.router_cache.get_by_tenant( message.tenant_id, self._context) if not router_id: LOG.warn('Router not found for tenant %s.' % message.tenant_id) else: message.router_id = router_id LOG.debug("Using router %s for tenant %s", router_id, message.tenant_id) return message def _should_process(self, target, message): message = self._populate_router_id(message) if not message.router_id: LOG.info('Ignoring message with no router found.') return False should_ignore, reason = self.db_api.router_in_debug( message.router_id) if should_ignore: LOG.info( 'Ignoring message intended for router %s in ' 'debug mode (reason: %s): %s', message.router_id, reason, message, ) return False if not self._should_process(target, message):
deleted_lines: def _should_process(self, message): if not self._should_process(message): # NOTE(adam_g): We dont necessarily know the router_id # till the sm has been created. this check should move to # _should_process() once thats changed. should_ignore, reason = self.db_api.router_in_debug( sm.router_id) if should_ignore: LOG.info( 'Ignoring message intended for router %s in ' 'debug mode (reason: %s): %s', sm.router_id, reason, message, ) continue

commit_message:
Update gitignore for coverage

When running `tox -e cover`, a .coverage file is created. This
file should be ignored so it's not checked in.

Change-Id: I5d4041191ba0882233f91c820c65da1460397087

commit_message:
Replace thin/thick capabilities with thin_provisioning

According to new common capabilities documentation
Manila has common capability thin_provisioning with
boolean value. That's why instances of
thin_provisioning_support and thick_provisioning_support
capabilities should be replaced with
thin_provisioning=True/False.

Depends-On: I2c5bdf5ef9bfd6c8e7e06dac1fde08ad56cc6af1
Change-Id: If366fb242e4903f0b2693132d312b9318f4d89a4
Partial-Bug: #1487467

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-28 14:07:25.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_api/tests/test_repositories.py', 'monasca_api/common/repositories/influxdb/metrics_repository.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/commit/c948a0445861bb012f044a08380945a0f6c73e46', 'message': 'Remove all invalid dimensions in returned metrics

The Monasca API states that dimensions may not begin with an underscore;
as such no dimensions should be returned that begin with an underscore,
even if they are in the database.

This issie was exposed by new behaviour in InfluxDB 0.9.0 which resulted
in a _key column always being included in returned output. This feature
is scheduled to be removed in 0.9.3, (see
https://github.com/influxdb/influxdb/issues/3076) but monasca-api should still
be robust against this behaviour.

Change-Id: I0b09ed18161742c861b73b1f1864750ae49778dd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove all invalid dimensions in returned metrics

The Monasca API states that dimensions may not begin with an underscore;
as such no dimensions should be returned that begin with an underscore,
even if they are in the database.

This issie was exposed by new behaviour in InfluxDB 0.9.0 which resulted
in a _key column always being included in returned output. This feature
is scheduled to be removed in 0.9.3, (see
https://github.com/influxdb/influxdb/issues/3076) but monasca-api should still
be robust against this behaviour.

Change-Id: I0b09ed18161742c861b73b1f1864750ae49778dd

commit_message:
Break out the code to update assets.

Make the asset updating script its own file so it can be called by
infra too.

Change-Id: I4e08315623b298eec93cd80759f413201b5e7333
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/70/218670/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -x ROOTDIR=`pushd $(dirname $0)/.. > /dev/null /dev/null; pwd; popd > /dev/null` echo $ROOTDIR pushd $ROOTDIR/openstack_catalog/web > /dev/null mkdir -p api/v1/ if [ ! -f api/v1/assets ] || [ static/assets.yaml -nt api/v1/assets ]; then python $ROOTDIR/tools/yaml2json.py < static/assets.yaml > api/v1/assets fi popd > /dev/null

compute, add those nodes roles to SSL tasks.yaml file.

commit_message:
Replace deprecated olso_db sqalchemy EngineFacade with enginefacade

Now that oslo_db EngineFacade is deprecated. Instead of
oslo.db.sqlalchemy.session.EngineFacade use
olso.db.sqlalchemy.session.enginefacade.LegacyEngineFacade. Which
is a helper class for removing the global engine instances from oslo.db

Change-Id: I0dd153081c7a635babc924aed764b85b8576df87
Closes-Bug: 1490571

commit_message:
Add pre-LPM method in the volume driver

The current volume driver does not have a separate pre live
migration method. During live migration, the volume must be
discovered on the target host VIOSes for VSCSI attached volumes,
but the connections will be automatically moved over.  This patch
separates the discovery and connect logic for use by live migration.
However, it only addresses VSCSI needs. It does not address NPIV
attached volumes.

Change-Id: I56f10b5f41c3fdef7afd723eac3f6cbe3256ccba
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm refs/changes/52/216852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def discover_volume(self): """Discover the volume. This method performs any discovery that is needed prior to attaching a volume. """ volume_id = self.connection_info['data']['volume_id'] found = False # Iterate through host vios list to find valid hdisks. for vios_w in self.tx_mgr.feed: status, device_name, udid = self._discover_volume_on_vios( vios_w, volume_id) # If we found one, no need to check the others. found = found or self._good_discovery(status, device_name, udid) return found def _good_discovery(self, status, device_name, udid): """Checks the hdisk discovery results for a good discovery.""" return device_name is not None and status in [ hdisk.LUAStatus.DEVICE_AVAILABLE, hdisk.LUAStatus.FOUND_ITL_ERR] def _discover_volume_on_vios(self, vios_w, volume_id): """Discovers an hdisk on a single vios for the volume. :param vios_w: VIOS wrapper to process :param volume_id: Volume to discover :returns: Status of the volume or None :returns: Device name or None :returns: LUN or None """ # Get the initiatior WWPNs, targets and Lun for the given VIOS. vio_wwpns, t_wwpns, lun = self._get_hdisk_itls(vios_w) # Build the ITL map and discover the hdisks on the Virtual I/O # Server (if any). itls = hdisk.build_itls(vio_wwpns, t_wwpns, lun) if len(itls) == 0: LOG.debug('No ITLs for VIOS %(vios)s for volume %(volume_id)s.' % {'vios': vios_w.name, 'volume_id': volume_id}) return None, None, None status, device_name, udid = hdisk.discover_hdisk( self.adapter, vios_w.uuid, itls) if self._good_discovery(status, device_name, udid): LOG.info(_LI('Discovered %(hdisk)s on vios %(vios)s for ' 'volume %(volume_id)s. Status code: %(status)s.'), {'hdisk': device_name, 'vios': vios_w.name, 'volume_id': volume_id, 'status': str(status)}) elif status == hdisk.LUAStatus.DEVICE_IN_USE: LOG.warn(_LW('Discovered device %(dev)s for volume %(volume)s ' 'on %(vios)s is in use. Error code: %(status)s.'), {'dev': device_name, 'volume': volume_id, 'vios': vios_w.name, 'status': str(status)}) return status, device_name, udid status, device_name, udid = self._discover_volume_on_vios( vios_w, volume_id) if self._good_discovery(status, device_name, udid): own set of initiator WWPNs, target WWPNs and Lun on which hdisk is mapped. It will determine and return the ITLs for the given VIOS.

Status code: %(status)s.'), {'hdisk': device_name, 'vios': vios_w.name, 'volume_id': volume_id, 'status': str(status)}) elif status == hdisk.LUAStatus.DEVICE_IN_USE: LOG.warn(_LW('Discovered device %(dev)s for volume %(volume)s ' 'on %(vios)s is in use. Error code: %(status)s.'), {'dev': device_name, 'volume': volume_id, 'vios': vios_w.name, 'status': str(status)}) own set of initiator WWPNs, target WWPNs and Lun on which hdisk is mapped.It will determine and return the ITLs for the given VIOS.

commit_message:
Add Share instances Admin API

Add admin API which allows:
- Get share instances of given share
- Get all share instances
- Get share instance details by id
- Reset share instance state
- Force-delete share instance

Add appropriate unit and tempest tests.

APIImpact
Change-Id: Ie96dfc18b491cb4d9705da4eaca5bc4ce43225ea
Partially-Implements: blueprint share-instances

commit_message:
Hibernate support added

- added ORM support with Hibernate
- rewritten two mysql repositories to use ORM

Change-Id: I22e342ca57b4cc62b12a44cdf503ce068b9b67b5

added_lines: /* * Copyright 2015 FUJITSU LIMITED * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except * in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License * is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express * or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under * the License. */ package monasca.thresh.infrastructure.persistence.sql; import java.util.Map; import java.util.Properties; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.AlarmActionDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.AlarmDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.AlarmDefinitionDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.AlarmMetricDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.MetricDefinitionDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.MetricDefinitionDimensionsDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.MetricDimensionDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.NotificationMethodDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.SubAlarmDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.SubAlarmDefinitionDb; import monasca.common.hibernate.db.SubAlarmDefinitionDimensionDb; import monasca.common.model.alarm.AlarmSeverity; import monasca.common.model.alarm.AlarmSubExpression; import monasca.thresh.domain.model.AlarmDefinition; import monasca.thresh.domain.model.SubExpression; import org.hibernate.Session; import org.hibernate.SessionFactory; import org.hibernate.boot.registry.StandardServiceRegistryBuilder; import org.hibernate.cfg.Configuration; import org.hibernate.service.ServiceRegistry; import org.joda.time.DateTime; import org.slf4j.Logger; import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory; import com.google.common.base.Joiner; public class HibernateUtil { private static final Logger logger = LoggerFactory.getLogger(HibernateUtil.class); private static final SessionFactory sessionFactory; public static final Joiner COMMA_JOINER = Joiner.on(','); static { try { Configuration configuration = new Configuration(); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(AlarmDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(AlarmDefinitionDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(AlarmMetricDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(MetricDefinitionDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(MetricDefinitionDimensionsDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(MetricDimensionDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(SubAlarmDefinitionDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(SubAlarmDefinitionDimensionDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(SubAlarmDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(AlarmActionDb.class); configuration.addAnnotatedClass(NotificationMethodDb.class); configuration.setProperties(getHikariH2Properties()); ServiceRegistry serviceRegistry = new StandardServiceRegistryBuilder().applySettings(configuration.getProperties()).build(); // builds a session factory from the service registry sessionFactory = configuration.buildSessionFactory(serviceRegistry); } catch (Throwable ex) { // Make sure you log the exception, as it might be swallowed System.err.println("Initial SessionFactory creation failed." + ex); throw new ExceptionInInitializerError(ex); } } private static Properties getHikariH2Properties() { Properties properties = new Properties(); properties.put("hibernate.connection.provider_class", "com.zaxxer.hikari.hibernate.HikariConnectionProvider"); properties.put("hibernate.hbm2ddl.auto", "create-drop"); properties.put("show_sql", true); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSourceClassName", "org.h2.jdbcx.JdbcDataSource"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.url", "jdbc:h2:mem:mon;MODE=PostgreSQL"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.user", "sa"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.password", ""); return properties; } private static Properties getHikariPostgresProperties() { Properties properties = new Properties(); properties.put("hibernate.connection.provider_class", "com.zaxxer.hikari.hibernate.HikariConnectionProvider"); properties.put("hibernate.hbm2ddl.auto", "validate"); properties.put("show_sql", true); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSourceClassName", "org.postgresql.ds.PGPoolingDataSource"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.serverName", "localhost"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.portNumber", "5432"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.databaseName", "mon"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.user", "mon"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.password", "mon"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.initialConnections", "25"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.dataSource.maxConnections", "100"); properties.put("hibernate.hikari.connectionTestQuery", "SELECT 1"); return properties; } public static void insertAlarmDefinition(Session session, AlarmDefinition ad) { AlarmDefinitionDb alarmDefininitionDb = null; try { session.beginTransaction(); alarmDefininitionDb = new AlarmDefinitionDb(); alarmDefininitionDb.setId(ad.getId()); alarmDefininitionDb.setTenant_id(ad.getTenantId()); alarmDefininitionDb.setName(ad.getName()); alarmDefininitionDb.setDescription(ad.getDescription()); alarmDefininitionDb.setSeverity(AlarmSeverity.LOW); alarmDefininitionDb.setExpression(ad.getAlarmExpression().getExpression()); alarmDefininitionDb.setMatch_by(ad.getMatchBy().isEmpty() ? null : COMMA_JOINER.join(ad.getMatchBy())); alarmDefininitionDb.setActions_enabled(ad.isActionsEnabled() ? 1 : 0); alarmDefininitionDb.setCreated_at(new DateTime()); alarmDefininitionDb.setUpdated_at(new DateTime()); alarmDefininitionDb.setDeleted_at(null); session.save(alarmDefininitionDb); for (final SubExpression subExpression : ad.getSubExpressions()) { final AlarmSubExpression alarmSubExpr = subExpression.getAlarmSubExpression(); SubAlarmDefinitionDb subAlarmDef = new SubAlarmDefinitionDb(subExpression.getId(), ad.getId(), alarmSubExpr.getFunction().name(), alarmSubExpr.getMetricDefinition().name, alarmSubExpr.getOperator().name(), alarmSubExpr.getThreshold(), alarmSubExpr.getPeriod(), alarmSubExpr.getPeriods(), new DateTime(), new DateTime()); session.save(subAlarmDef); for (final Map.Entry<String, String> entry : alarmSubExpr.getMetricDefinition().dimensions.entrySet()) { SubAlarmDefinitionDimensionDb dimension = new SubAlarmDefinitionDimensionDb(subExpression.getId(), entry.getKey(), entry.getValue()); session.save(dimension); } } session.getTransaction().commit(); } catch (RuntimeException e) { try { session.getTransaction().rollback(); } catch (RuntimeException rbe) { logger.error("Couldnâ€™t roll back transaction", rbe); } throw e; } finally { if (session != null) { session.close(); } } } public static SessionFactory getSessionFactory() { return sessionFactory; } }

commit_message:
Retain single hashed comments in secrets file

This patch ensures secrets files processed by pw-token-gen retain:
* Licence header
* Commented out keys

The implementaiton stores all single hashed lines and inserts them into
the output file before the yaml dump.

Double hashed lines are not retained as they are section headers and
wouldn't make sense in the output.

Change-Id: Iea111a25b690188de8c177486ac5fed6699dd920
Closes-Bug: #1483788
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/09/211609/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re # Read comments seperately as safe_load ignores them f.seek(0) # Only keep single hashed lines (commented out secrets), not double # hashed lines which are generally headings. comment_re = re.compile('^\s*#[^#]') comments = [line for line in f.readlines() if comment_re.match(line)] # Add comments back into output file f.writelines(comments)

commit_message:
Allow users to specify backup encryption key

Currently all backups are encrypted using a static key. This spec aims
to add the ability for a user to provide a backup encryption key.

Change-Id: If2610ca2915b53eda8eb320a3343258618bf0620
Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/backup-encryption-keys
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove-specs refs/changes/50/185950/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode Sections of this template were taken directly from the Nova spec template at: https://github.com/openstack/nova-specs/blob/master/specs/template.rst ================= Backup Encryption ================= .. sectnum:: .. contents:: Currently all backups generated by Trove are encrypted (if so configured) with a static key that is used system wide. This has some benefits and some drawbacks. This spec is aimed at addressing the drawbacks. Launchpad Blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/backup-encryption-keys Problem Description =================== Currently the Trove backup and restore feature encrypt a backup using openssl and a static key (backup_aes_cbc_key) if backup_use_openssl_encrypt is set to true. This is (by default) enabled and operators, I am told, would prefer to have backups encrypted rather than in plain text to minimize their liabilities arising from loss of data. The encryption erects at least a small barrier of protection. Yet, a static key has some issues. First, it is a system-wide, static key. If changed, it would invalidate all existing backups. But for the reason stated above, encryption is favored. Proposed Change =============== The proposal is that Trove (no longer) use the static system-wide key for backup encryption. Rather, when a user attempts to launch a backup, it should accept a pass-phrase from the user and use that as, or in the generation of a backup key. When the user wishes to launch a new instance based on a backup, the user will be required to provide the key. The above would address part of the problem in the future. It still leaves at least two issues to be addressed. First, operators prefer a backup be encrypted rather than be stored in plain text. For this, it is proposed that we continue to use the existing system-wide static key mechanism. Second, when changing keys, care must be taken to ensure that old backups can still be read. By retaining the legacy key mechanism as the fall-back if no key is provided, we ensure that old backups can still be read. Configuration ------------- The proposal is that a new configuration parameter be added. backup_require_encryption_key [True| False] default: False If set to True, backup will require the user to provide an encryption key. If set to False, the system performance will default to the present operation(s). Database -------- There is no proposed schema change. Public API ---------- The backup-create and create API calls require a new parameter: backup_encryption_key. Public API Security ------------------- The proposed API changes introduce a scheme that will send an encryption key as part of a ReST'ful call. Sending this key in plain text over the network is not prudent. However, since the key needs to be used on the receiving side, a one-way cipher cannot be used. Options to protect the key in flight would be a reversible cipher, a pki scheme, or to rely on the encryption of the underlying transport. In the absence of a multi-step exchange between the client and the API service which would lend itself to a secure exchange of a password, we propose the use of a simple reversible cipher, and to rely on the security of the underlying transport. Python API ---------- Nothing is removed. CLI (python-troveclient) ------------------------ Yes, the Trove client will now accept the new pass phrase on the backup-create and the create calls. Internal API ------------ Yes, the key needs to make its way over to the guest agent. Guest Agent ----------- Yes, and the proposed behavior is backwards compatible. Alternatives ------------ One alternative that was considered was to introduce a more secure way of getting the key from the client to the API service. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: amrith Milestones ---------- Liberty-1 Work Items ---------- TBD Upgrade Implications ==================== Existing backups will be preserved as the legacy behavior is preserved. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= TBD Documentation Impact ==================== The user documentation and the API documentation will need to be changed. References ========== None

commit_message:
[monasca-common] Hibernate support added

- refactored code to match java guidelines
- added missed indexes
- fixed invalid string lengths according to latest mon.sql from ansible-monasca-schema
- introduced relations
- using ordinal for enum fields

Change-Id: Ic84bf542c10ff714885c7a53bb9cbe3a2fb728cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-common refs/changes/30/198230/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: /* * Copyright 2015 FUJITSU LIMITED * * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except * in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at * * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 * * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License * is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express * or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under * the License. */ package monasca.common.model.log; import java.io.IOException; import monasca.common.util.Exceptions; import org.apache.commons.lang3.StringEscapeUtils; import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonGenerator; import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException; import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializer; import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper; import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.PropertyNamingStrategy; import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializerProvider; import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.module.SimpleModule; /** * Utilities for working with Logs. */ public final class Logs { static final ObjectMapper OBJECT_MAPPER = new ObjectMapper(); static { OBJECT_MAPPER.setPropertyNamingStrategy(PropertyNamingStrategy.CAMEL_CASE_TO_LOWER_CASE_WITH_UNDERSCORES); SimpleModule module = new SimpleModule(); module.addSerializer(new LogSerializer()); OBJECT_MAPPER.registerModule(module); } /** Log serializer */ private static class LogSerializer extends JsonSerializer<Log> { @Override public Class<Log> handledType() { return Log.class; } public void serialize(Log log, JsonGenerator jgen, SerializerProvider provider) throws IOException, JsonProcessingException { jgen.writeStartObject(); if (log.applicationType != null && !log.applicationType.isEmpty()) { jgen.writeStringField("application_type", log.applicationType); } if (log.dimensions != null && !log.dimensions.isEmpty()) { jgen.writeObjectField("dimensions", log.dimensions); } jgen.writeStringField("message", log.message); jgen.writeEndObject(); } } private Logs() { } /** * Returns the Log for the {@code logJson}. * * @throws RuntimeException if an error occurs while parsing {@code logJson} */ public static Log fromJson(byte[] logJson) { try { String jsonStr = StringEscapeUtils.unescapeJava(new String(logJson, "UTF-8")); return OBJECT_MAPPER.readValue(jsonStr, Log.class); } catch (Exception e) { throw Exceptions.uncheck(e, "Failed to parse log json: %s", new String(logJson)); } } /** * Returns the JSON representation of the {@code log} else null if it could not be converted to * JSON. */ public static String toJson(Log log) { try { return OBJECT_MAPPER.writeValueAsString(log); } catch (JsonProcessingException e) { return null; } } }

commit_message:
doc: document how to install from packages

Change-Id: I5d9adfd3b5bcea0b0aace55ed342465986f3ba11
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/10/219310/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Install from packages ===================== Packages for RHEL/CentOS 7 and Ubuntu 14.04 are available for the Kilo release. For RHEL/CentOS 7 ----------------- #. Enable the EPEL and RDO repositories for Kilo: :: yum install https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/7/x86_64/e/epel-release-7-5.noarch.rpm yum install http://rdo.fedorapeople.org/openstack-kilo/rdo-release-kilo.rpm #. Create the ``/etc/yum.repos.d/cloudkitty.repo`` configuration file to enable the CloudKitty repository: .. code-block:: ini [cloudkitty] name=CloudKitty repository (kilo) baseurl=http://archive.objectif-libre.com/cloudkitty/el7/kilo/ gpgcheck=1 gpgkey=http://archive.objectif-libre.com/ol.asc #. Install the packages: :: yum install cloudkitty-api cloudkitty-processor cloudkitty-dashboard For Ubuntu 14.04 ---------------- #. Enable the Canonical cloud-archive repository for the Kilo release: :: apt-get install ubuntu-cloud-keyring echo "deb http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu trusty-updates/kilo main" \ > /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloudarchive-kilo.list #. Install the CloudKitty repository public key and configure apt: :: apt-key adv --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 71E414B3 echo 'deb http://archive.objectif-libre.com/cloudkitty/ubuntu trusty/kilo main' > \ /etc/apt/sources.list.d/cloudkitty-kilo.list apt-get update #. Install the packages: :: apt-get install cloudkitty-api cloudkitty-processor cloudkitty-dashboard

Finalize rename of token_endpoint to admin_token

If the plugin and the loader are called admin_token, the class
implemeting the functionality should be too.

commit_message:
Note about broken pacemaker resources monitoring cases

Describe the possible case when Pacemaker stops monitoring
its RabbitMQ or other resources, while keeps reporting the
healthy statuses blindly.

Related-bug: #1472230

Change-Id: I611b68d2931d4e4515840c68b864d4fcb01974e7
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/50/218150/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. note:: If there are split clusters of Corosync running, you should first fix your Corosync cluster, because you cannot resolve issues with the Pacemaker resources, including RabbitMQ cluster, when there is a split brain in the Corosync cluster. You may also want to collect an extended status output with the crm tool alternative:.. note:: If the master_p_rabbitmq-server's ``pcs status`` output looks "good" but there is outdated time stamp of the last monitor action displayed in the last-rc-change section, you should clean up the master_p_rabbitmq-server, see below for how to recover. .. warn:: This state is very dangerous as Pacemaker thinks everything is alright, while in fact it doesn't monitor the resource health anymore! This also applies to the rest of the resources reported by the ``crm_mon -fotAW -1`` command.
deleted_lines: You can also try issuing an extended output with the crm tool alternative:.. note:: If there are split clusters of Corosync running, you should first fix your Corosync cluster, because you cannot resolve issues with the Pacemaker resources, including RabbitMQ cluster, when there is a split brain in the Corosync cluster.

commit_message:
Only mark metadata packets on internal interfaces

Currently iptables rules set on L3 agent with metadata_proxy enabled
mark all packets coming from all interfaces including external interfaces.

This change updates PREROUTING rules from MANGLE table to mark packets
only from internal interfaces.

Change-Id: I01549df7b99be84cd46b6f97a5fd62aec1f43275
Closes-Bug: #1477553

commit_message:
Better doc for installing the nailgun dev env

- every command can run unattended
- following them produce a reliable installation (a poor man's literate
  programming)
- works well with isend-mode.el
- remove bashism (source for .)

Closes-Bug: #1474747
Change-Id: Iab0cc0e17dfa113c9194793f239f57f91492cf35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/96/201996/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Please note that these instructions were tested on Ubuntu 12.04.4 (64 bit) and Ubuntu 14.04 (64 bit) that both contain Python 2.7 and require downgrade to Python 2.6. sudo add-apt-repository --yes ppa:fkrull/deadsnakes sudo apt-get install --yes python2.6 python2.6-dev.. Do as 3.3.3. Configuring Postgresql database in devops https://docs.fuel-infra.org/fuel-dev/devops.html#configuring-postgresql-database #. Install and configure PostgreSQL database (9.1 for ubuntu 12.04 and 9.3 for ubuntu 14.04):: sudo apt-get install --yes postgresql postgresql-server-dev-all sudo sed -ir 's/peer/trust/' /etc/postgresql/9.*/main/pg_hba.conf sudo service postgresql restart sudo -u postgres psql -c "CREATE ROLE nailgun WITH LOGIN PASSWORD 'nailgun'" sudo apt-get install --yes python-dev python-pip . /usr/local/bin/virtualenvwrapper.sh # you can save this to .bashrc sudo apt-get install --yes git git clone https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-web.git sudo apt-get remove --yes nodejs nodejs-legacy sudo apt-get install --yes software-properties-common sudo apt-get install --yes libfontconfig # missing package required by phantomjs sudo add-apt-repository --yes ppa:chris-lea/node.js sudo apt-get install --yes nodejs # The following fixes a know bug # https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1337343/comments/6 sudo chown --recursive --from=root `id -un`:`id -gn` `npm config get cache` #. To rebuild the static resources (css and js):: gulp build
deleted_lines: Please note that these instructions were tested on Ubuntu 12.04.4 (64 bit) that contains Python 2.7 and requires downgrade to Python 2.6. sudo add-apt-repository ppa:fkrull/deadsnakes sudo apt-get install python2.6 python2.6-dev#. Install and configure PostgreSQL database:: sudo apt-get install postgresql postgresql-server-dev-9.1 sudo -u postgres createuser -SDRP nailgun # enter password "nailgun" sudo apt-get install python-dev python-pip source /usr/local/bin/virtualenvwrapper.sh # you can save this to .bashrc sudo apt-get remove nodejs nodejs-legacy sudo apt-get install software-properties-common sudo apt-get install libfontconfig # missing package required by phantomjs sudo add-apt-repository ppa:chris-lea/node.js sudo apt-get install nodejs

commit_message:
Move congress/mistral integration related tests to separated dir

- Move congress/mistral related integration tests to 'integration' dir in
murano/tests/functional
- Change launch test shell script considering to change above.

Change-Id: I35df5de320134280aaa022a4da8e0ee76546eb7c
Closes-Bug: #1490952

commit_message:
Two fixes for ns_IPaddr2 OCF script

* Allow gateway for VIP to be an
  * none
  * link
  * ip address
  for correct processing into ns_IPaddr2 OCF script
* Operate with OVS-based bridges

Change-Id: Idfb7b45fedbccef1e4dc127ab64505f238ea286e
Closes-bug: #1490596

commit_message:
Enable warning messages from library

Now we are trying to make some tempest-lib classes deprecated, then
this patch makes warning messages from the other libraries enabled
to output them into logging for service client initialization.

Change-Id: I1528c8dc51413540f273944572f54ccbcd0cda40

commit_message:
Handling corner cases in dynamic looping call

If the periodic task for dynamic looping call returns no suggestion for
delay, then we should use periodic_interval_max. If
periodic_interval_max is not specified, we should raise RuntimeError.
Otherwise, passing 'None' as a value, causes Exception at eventlet's
sleep() call.

Change-Id: Ida3e75bc64132d6b5920fa94657aa962e2fe9f53
Closes-bug: #1489998
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.service refs/changes/14/218414/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: _TASK_MISSING_SLEEP_VALUE_MESSAGE = _("A dynamic interval task should supply either" " an interval or periodic_interval_max") if delay is None: delay = periodic_interval_max if delay is None: raise RuntimeError(self._TASK_MISSING_SLEEP_VALUE_MESSAGE)

subject: Fix ubuntu image builds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-01 11:10:56.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/functions_qemu'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove-integration/commit/645a3468c675cc17cb4c7432d6c94dd1bd69f94f', 'message': 'Fix ubuntu image builds

The format for the SHA256SUMS file recently changed to refer to the
images using the release version nomenclature (e.g. ubuntu 14.04) as
opposed to the release code name (e.g. trusty). This was causing ubuntu
based image builds to fail. Fix this by explicitly specifying the release
version as the BASE_IMAGE_FILE so that dib can use this consistently
throughout.

Change-Id: I36bfba75c22b0a153eda2fcc3137fcefa9a29536
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ubuntu image builds

The format for the SHA256SUMS file recently changed to refer to the
images using the release version nomenclature (e.g. ubuntu 14.04) as
opposed to the release code name (e.g. trusty). This was causing ubuntu
based image builds to fail. Fix this by explicitly specifying the release
version as the BASE_IMAGE_FILE so that dib can use this consistently
throughout.

Change-Id: I36bfba75c22b0a153eda2fcc3137fcefa9a29536

commit_message:
Remove s from sleep command

The default for sleep is to use seconds. On platforms that do not
support an operand with 's' this will fail

Change-Id: I76b5dac863d9f94f9e971e60ff2bb41866133081
Closes-Bug: #1490062

subject: Fix poor examples of exception logging
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-28 13:50:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/usage.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log/commit/f718919c459be88d24fbf96a97856835c611b7a8', 'message': 'Fix poor examples of exception logging

There were several examples showing passing an
exception in as the message text to a call to
LOG.exception. LOG.exception will automatically
log the exception details, so doing something
like this results in the exception information
being written out twice.

To prevent the possibility of someone seeing these
examples and assuming that is the correct way to
use LOG.exception, examples have been updated to
use LOG.error instead to illustrate the correct
way to pass in exceptions in the message string.

Change-Id: I582008609180a02eaff3d85bee5b5ca4381719ce
'}]
commit_message:
Fix poor examples of exception logging

There were several examples showing passing an
exception in as the message text to a call to
LOG.exception. LOG.exception will automatically
log the exception details, so doing something
like this results in the exception information
being written out twice.

To prevent the possibility of someone seeing these
examples and assuming that is the correct way to
use LOG.exception, examples have been updated to
use LOG.error instead to illustrate the correct
way to pass in exceptions in the message string.

Change-Id: I582008609180a02eaff3d85bee5b5ca4381719ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.log refs/changes/73/218273/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The most common place to encounter this is where :meth:`Logger.error` LOG.error(err) LOG.error(_LE(u"do_something couldn't do something: %s"), err) LOG.error(six.text_type(err))
deleted_lines: The most common place to encounter this is where :meth:`Logger.exception` LOG.exception(err) LOG.exception(_LE(u"do_something couldn't do something: %s"), err) LOG.exception(six.text_type(err))

commit_message:
Fix parameter description error

Since this API "Gets details for a specified resource",
the parameter "resource_id" should not be "Optional".
Change "resource_id" from "Optional" to "Required".

Closes-Bug: #1489301
Change-Id: If1ebe527e0da7f1616530353f5085824e22cee2e

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/17/219017/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1. LIAISON: If the release includes any completed blueprints, go to launchpad and create a ``next-$SERIES`` milestone as part of the ``$SERIES`` release. Set the targets for the blueprints to ``next-$SERIES`` and mark them as implemented. If there are no blueprints, this step can be skipped. 2. LIAISON: If this is a stable release and there are bugs to be reported as fixed, create a ``next-$SERIES`` milestone as part of the ``$SERIES`` release and target the bugs to the milestone. Set their status to ``Fix Committed``. If the release is from the ``master`` branch, this step can be skipped. 3. RELEASE TEAM: The release team member taking responsibility for the release should approve the change in ``openstack/releases``. Release requests should not be approved until we are actually ready to cut the release. 4. RELEASE TEAM: After the release request merges, check out or update a local copy of ``openstack/releases`` to get the new version of the deliverable file. 5. RELEASE TEAM: In a local copy of this ``openstack-infra/release-tools`` repository, run ``release_from_yaml.py``, giving the path to the deliverable file and the version from that file that needs to be released as arguments.6. RELEASE TEAM: As the release script runs, it reports on the existing tags in the branch being released and offers a last chance to review the new tag in light of the history. Press ``<return>`` when ready to continue, then enter the pass phrase for your GPG key to add the tag. 7. RELEASE TEAM: After the tag is created locally and pushed up to the remote server, the script generates a release announcement email with some basic change information. It prints the results to the console, and saves a copy in ``relnotes/$project-$version``. The file is a fully formatted email, ready to be processed with a tool like ``msmtp``.8. RELEASE TEAM: After the release notes are written out, the script ensures that a launchpad milestone with the version number is created. If there is a ``next-$SERIES`` milestone, it is renamed and used. For releases from ``master``, all closed bugs are targeted to the new milestone. For stable branches, bugs should be targeted explicitly (see step 2).
deleted_lines: 1. If the release includes any completed blueprints, go to launchpad and create a ``next-$SERIES`` milestone as part of the ``$SERIES`` release. Set the targets for the blueprints to ``next-$SERIES`` and mark them as implemented. If there are no blueprints, this step can be skipped. 2. If this is a stable release and there are bugs to be reported as fixed, create a ``next-$SERIES`` milestone as part of the ``$SERIES`` release and target the bugs to the milestone. Set their status to ``Fix Committed``. If the release is from the ``master`` branch, this step can be skipped. 3. The release team member taking responsibility for the release should approve the change in ``openstack/releases``. Release requests should not be approved until we are actually ready to cut the release. 4. After the release request merges, check out or update a local copy of ``openstack/releases`` to get the new version of the deliverable file. 5. In a local copy of this ``openstack-infra/release-tools`` repository, run ``release_from_yaml.py``, giving the path to the deliverable file and the version from that file that needs to be released as arguments.6. As the release script runs, it reports on the existing tags in the branch being released and offers a last chance to review the new tag in light of the history. Press ``<return>`` when ready to continue, then enter the pass phrase for your GPG key to add the tag. 7. After the tag is created locally and pushed up to the remote server, the script generates a release announcement email with some basic change information. It prints the results to the console, and saves a copy in ``relnotes/$project-$version``. The file is a fully formatted email, ready to be processed with a tool like ``msmtp``.8. After the release notes are written out, the script ensures that a launchpad milestone with the version number is created. If there is a ``next-$SERIES`` milestone, it is renamed and used. For releases from ``master``, all closed bugs are targeted to the new milestone. For stable branches, bugs should be targeted explicitly (see step 2).

commit_message:
Allow debug flag in Barbican tox and debugging documentation

Allows user to run 'tox -e debug' in order to hit breakpoints in
unit tests. Also addes documentation on using pdb and rpdb.

Change-Id: I75d2780598b989b47b1a5a16712cdaa733872f6a

commit_message:
Fix using nic_mapping in network templates

  * Use 'network_assignments' field from processed network_template
   with applied nic mappings for each node instead of using this field
   from raw template

Change-Id: I0f789386a6de56d04476a7ced1ba389677a98388
Closes-bug: #1489508

commit_message:
Fix GET queue metadata for sqlalchemy

When using sql as the management plane and get queue, user
will run into 503 error since we're using self.driver.get,
but unfortunately, there is no get() method in sqlalchemy's
ControlDriver. This patch fixes the issue by using run()
instead of get().

Closes-Bug: #1489701

Change-Id: I064e123eae3617861804092f4f7a1b194a5ec136
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/83/218083/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return utils.json_decode(self.driver.run(sel).fetchone()[0])

commit_message:
Catch OpenSSL ImportError

OpenSSL is used in VMAX driver, but causes test failure
in other places when it is not installed. This patch adds
a try except for the ImportError.

Change-Id: I85f2563a89fd1c94e6c324c2ae693e91c70fbe3d
Closes-Bug: #1490668
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/81/218981/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: try: import OpenSSL except ImportError: OpenSSL = None

commit_message:
Add specific list method for NovaServer res

Nova API returns limited number of resources by one call. To clean all nova
servers, we should:
- list all pages(via marker option) [old novaclient].
- use limit=-1 and novaclient will list all pages for us.

Closes-Bug: #1490940
Change-Id: Ic4d2852d9fd7602ac99b08654d2f99c52adf1cfe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/26/217126/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def list(self): """List all servers.""" # NOTE(andreykurilin): Nova API returns only limited number( # 'osapi_max_limit' option in nova.conf) of servers, so we need # to use 'marker' option to list all pages of servers. # FIXME(andreykurilin): Remove this code, when a corresponding change # will be merged in novaclient(see # https://review.openstack.org/#/c/217101 for more details) and # the minimum version of novaclient in requirements will allow it. result = [] marker = None while True: servers = self._manager().list(marker=marker) if not servers: break result.extend(servers) marker = servers[-1].id return result

Convergence: in resource_by_refid() don't check the state

(if using cached data, as the state is not cached)

commit_message:
Convergence: add support for the path_component

store the attr name and path so attributes don't get shadowed
e.g. get_attr: [res1, attr_x, show]
     get_attr: [res1, attr_x, something]

Change-Id: I724e91b32776aa5813d2b821c2062424e0635a69

commit_message:
Updates to support glanceclient v1_0

This updates the devtest scripts so they support using
--visibility instead of --is-public.

Add --container-format to places where glance is called
as its now required.

Use "nova image-show" in place of glance, as glance now
only take an image id and no longer accepts the image name.

Change-Id: Id44afde796c5aa660628f7f8890f74e2024288af
Closes-bug: #1490792

added_lines: API should return 400 Bad Request in case of the following bad scenarios (that are possible from CLI): string or a string with more that 100 characters)* user wants to delete label(s) of non-existing node "name": "node#1", fuel2 node label set key_1=[value_1] [key_2=[value_2] ... ] \ -n | --nodes node_id_1 [node_id_2 ...] fuel2 node label set key_1=[value_1] [key_2=[value_2] ... ] -n | --nodes-all fuel2 node label delete key_1[=value_1] [key_2[=value_2] ... ] \ fuel2 node label delete --labels-all --nodes-all fuel2 node label list key1[=value_1] [key2[=value_2] ... ] \It should also be possible to filter nodes by labels and its values :: fuel2 node list --labels key1[=value_1] [key2[=value_2] ... ] Node labels should also be shown in the output of ``fuel2 node list`` command, but should not be included to the output of the command ``fuel2 node show``,* Julia Aranovich (jkirnosova@mirantis.com) - JS and Nailgun code* Andrey Popovych (apopovych@mirantis.com) - CLI code
deleted_lines: Also valid label key and value strings should not contain '=' character. This limitation goes from CLI command syntax (see `For Fuel Client`_ section).API should return 400 Bad Request in case of the following bad scenarios: string or an empty string or a string with more that 100 characters)* user wants to delete label(s) of non-existing node (the operation possible from CLI) * user wants to get a non-existing label of node(s) (the operation possible from CLI) * user wants to get label(s) of non-existing node (the operation possible from CLI) "name": "cluster#1", "release_id": 2,Node labels should be reset to defaults (an empty object) after deleting node from environment. fuel2 node label set -l | --label key_1=[value_1] \ [-l | --label key_2=[value_2] ... ] -n | --nodes node_id_1 [node_id_2 ...] fuel2 node label set -l | --label key_1=[value_1] \ [-l | --label key_2=[value_2] ... ] -n | --nodes all fuel2 node label delete -l | --label key1 [-l | --label key2 ... ] \ fuel2 node label delete -l | --label all -n | --nodes all fuel2 node label list -l | --label key1 [-l | --label key2 ... ] \Node labels should also be shown in the output of ``fuel2 node show`` command, but should not be included to the output of the command ``fuel2 node list``,* Julia Aranovich (jkirnosova@mirantis.com) - JS code * Vitaly Kramskikh (vkramskikh@mirantis.com) - Python code

commit_message:
Use min and max on IntOpt option types

Latest version of oslo.config support the ability to set valid
range on IntOpt option values.  This path makes use of that feature
for a number of options with well known minimum and maximum values.

Change-Id: I31ce8977331244ad60bcc3f05ae66fb25506872f

commit_message:
zuul/layout: make non-voting some trusty beaker jobs

Ubuntu packaging for Liberty - called Liberty Staging - is broken for
one month for heat, ironic and python-glanceclient.
It currently blocks our CI to land patches.

To unblock the situation, this patch aims to make the 3 jobs non-voting
but still running so we can monitor them and revert this patch when
packages are stable enough.

Jobs that we want non-voting:
* gate-puppet-glance-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-trusty
* gate-puppet-heat-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-trusty
* gate-puppet-ironic-puppet-beaker-rspec-dsvm-trusty

Change-Id: Id34550890f3dabb1cc3fd30dda6583b5847f0cd2
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/78/219078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Once Ubuntu provides stable packaging, revert this non-voting setting. - name: ^gate-puppet-openstack-integration-dsvm-.*$ name: ^gate-puppet-glance-(glance|ironic|heat)-beaker-rspec-dsvm-trusty$ voting: false

subject: Fix the procedure in Cloud Administrator Guide
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-09-01 09:50:17.000000000', 'files': ['doc/admin-guide-cloud/source/keystone_integrate_identity_backend_ldap.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals/commit/65bf85a7a241e702e91e7e04ea07436c5f6478d0', 'message': 'Fix the procedure in Cloud Administrator Guide

After the procedure titled "Integrating Identity with multiple back
ends", there is a Note. After the Note, a new procedure appears to start
with "1. Define the destination LDAP server...". It is part of the

commit_message:
Fix the procedure in Cloud Administrator Guide

After the procedure titled "Integrating Identity with multiple back
ends", there is a Note. After the Note, a new procedure appears to start
with "1. Define the destination LDAP server...". It is part of the
previous procedure, then the Note should be correctly indented so the
numbering continues correctly.

Change-Id: If10ba714f6a86124dc3de419dae017f4cf733c49
Closes-Bug: #1490791

commit_message:
Fix the reversed incoming parameters of assertEqual

For example.
self.assertEqual(self.client.packages.create.call_count, 2)
According the definition of assertEqual as below, it is reversed.
def assertEqual(self, expected, observed, message=''):
  :param expected: The expected value.
  :param observed: The observed value.
  :param message: An optional message to include in the error

Change-Id: If8a3531745fef44ef2dabaca64811ba26c4b861b
Closes-Bug: #1490370

commit_message:
ASG scaling account for cooldown timestamp & in-progress

There are cases where it takes a long time to create a new resource as
requested by the scaling operation on an ASG resource, for instance, a
nova server creation followed by a complex SoftwareDeployment. During
this process, additional alarms may come in but failed to be blocked
by the current cooldown checking mechanism because the very first
timestamp has yet to be generated. This is leading to unexpected size
adjustment to the ASG.

This patch augments the existing cooldown checking mechanism with a
scaling-in-progress test so that additional alarms arriving during
the very first scaling operation will be ignored.

Closes-Bug: #1375156

Conflicts:
	heat/engine/resources/openstack/heat/scaling_policy.py
	heat/scaling/cooldown.py
	heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_group.py
	heat/tests/autoscaling/test_heat_scaling_policy.py
	heat/tests/autoscaling/test_scaling_group.py
	heat/tests/autoscaling/test_scaling_policy.py

(cherry-picked from b76881b8bcb3e381c5b993a0c84afd37abd8ea5b)
Change-Id: Ib8aa83eed366df7097c9cbb9247eca866ae4b620

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: convert UUID correctly before doing a search

Currently UUID are passed as string to SQLAlchemy, but that ends up
failing in a DBError if the RDBMS cannot transform a random string to a
valid UUID. We now convert the value to a ResourceUUID, except if it
fails, where we returns a 400 error.

Change-Id: I17adb24ffd169cba6606314c7de7f62b409d4fb4
Closes-Bug: #1490553

commit_message:
Add index to metadata_hash column of resource table

Resource table's metadata_hash column is not indexed.

Adding index on metadata_hash column reduces number
of rows scanned to one. That is if a resource
(same resource_id) has say n rows in resource table
(due to difference in metadata), with additional index
only one row will have to be scanned.

Change-Id: I2a99bdac88f5fa14ac5f82497d1a12196419ae68
Closes-Bug: #1488544

commit_message:
Add license headers to the panel/dashboard templates

This patch adds the Apache2 license headers to the panel/dashboard
templates used in the 'Tutorial: Building a Dashboard using Horizon'
to generate new panels/dashboards.

This solves the hacking issue 'H102  Apache 2.0 license header not
found'.

Co-Authored-By: Thomas Kaergel <kaergel@b1-systems.de>

Change-Id: Ic48053c06be00439dfaf8ac49df8fb577898cab4

commit_message:
Read networking_bgpvpn.conf for service providers

With this patch, Neutron will read (/etc/neutron/)networking_bgpvpn.conf
for service_provider definitions, thus allowing the use of
the BGPVPN service plugin additionally to other service relying
on their own neutron_*aas.conf file.

This patch also fixes README and devstack behavior so that
a default networking-bgpvpn.conf file is deployed.

This depends on change Ia4cad678e6c722ca05821dbdbf05d61523246a86

Change-Id: Ifebe4c965448431737d9f0e4c25605b718850460
Closes-bug: 1473119
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-bgpvpn refs/changes/27/208527/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NETWORKING_BGPVPN_CONF=/etc/neutron/neutron_bgpvpn.conf

commit_message:
Run compress command for dashboard in devstack

Adds compress --force call, similar to the on lib/horizon in devstack
has, to allow auto discovery of static assets in horizon.

Change-Id: I4fb3650071ff6c166cb25c6d5036f8f5052cc35e
Closes-Bug: #1490510

added_lines: python "$horizon_manage_py" compress --force

commit_message:
make gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ssh non voting

Currently this is wedging all number of things because ironic is using
diskimage builder to pull things from ubuntu upstream and a name
change in their images meant things no longer SHA256 correctly.

We should make this non-voting to fix things, and ensure we're not
making it voting again until this is no longer pulling from the open
internet.

Change-Id: I9002e32126a3f07efa857aa60f5431b409edb8b9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/40/219240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # This should remain non-voting until it no longer requires disk # image builder talking to ubuntu servers directly on every gate # run. - name: ^gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ssh voting: false

commit_message:
move keystonemiddleware to requirements.txt

We currently require keystonemiddleware to setup correclty
oslo config object, but once version 2.2 will be released,

commit_message:
Add a service catalog override url for the functional tests

This lets us run functional tests that need to auth with keystone
but that need to run against a url outside of the service catalog.

Change-Id: Ie3f739ea2626bd0c597188f3312a7c2b950ae4fb

commit_message:
devstack: remove ceilometer from service list

Ceilometer is no more need to run this job,
The Ceilometer publisher stuffs have been moved to Ceilometer
code tree.

Change-Id: I8ddf0e779de08edcd17e9744bd463380bce9886a

commit_message:
Fix incorrect variable name in some exception class

At manila.exception:
msg_fmt => message

Reason:
When msg_fmt is passed to parent class, the information is not shown
because parent class expect variable 'message'.

Change-Id: I3e1346e7d6258eac4a5df965e4315090fbfcda0b
Closes-Bug: #1487247
